name: Slovak Nut Rolls
author: Bob
summary: This is an old Slovak recipe.  In Slovak it is called Roshky.  The rolls are filled with lekvar, a thick, soft fruit spread.  This is an all day project.  This recipe will make 7 or 8 twelve inch loaves, or some dough may be reserved for lekvar squares.
directions: Mix together walnuts, 1 cup sugar, and 1/ 8 teaspoon cinnamon
In a separate bowl, mix lekvar with lemon juice and 1/8 teaspoon cinnamon
In a large bowl, combine 1 cup sugar, 2 cups butter or margarine, and 6 eggs
Add sour cream, milk, flour, yeast, and salt
Beat thoroughly until dough does not stick to hands
Roll out each ball on a lightly floured board to a rectangle
Place on greased pans, and let stand for approximately 4 hours to raise before baking
Brush tops with beaten egg yolk just before placing in oven
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden brown
